items.summary: Replace the simulated phone OTP login flow with Internet Identity authentication. Update the Login screen (`/login`) to display a single 'Sign In' button (replacing the phone number input, country code selector, OTP fields, and terms checkbox). Tapping 'Sign In' triggers the Internet Identity login popup using the `useInternetIdentity` hook already available at `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`. After successful login, check whether a user profile exists in the backend: if no profile exists, navigate to `/profile-setup`; if a profile exists, navigate to `/home`. Remove the `/otp-verification` route and page.

Update the Splash screen (`/splash`) to determine authentication state using the `useInternetIdentity` hook's identity/isAuthenticated value instead of checking localStorage for a phone OTP session. If authenticated, redirect to `/home`; otherwise redirect to `/login`.

Update the Logout button on the Profile screen (`/profile`) to call the `logout` method from the `useInternetIdentity` hook instead of simply clearing localStorage. After logout, redirect to `/login`.

Update the Layout component (`frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx`) to use the `useInternetIdentity` hook to detect authentication instead of reading from localStorage. Unauthenticated users accessing protected routes should be redirected to `/login`.

Update the Profile Setup screen (`/profile-setup`) to derive the user identifier from the Internet Identity principal (via `useInternetIdentity`) rather than from a phone number stored in localStorage. Use the principal text as the user ID when calling the backend `createUserProfile` method. Since phone number is no longer collected during login, make the phone field on the profile setup form optional.

Update all frontend query hooks in `frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts` that currently look up the current user by phone number from localStorage to instead use the Internet Identity principal obtained from the `useActor` / `useInternetIdentity` hooks as the user identifier for backend calls.
